<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<B>
	Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking
	Statements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	This Annual Report on Form 10-K contains
	forward-looking statements concerning our business, operations and financial performance and condition as well as our plans, objectives
	and expectations for our business operations and financial performance and condition that are subject to risks and uncertainties.
	All statements other than statements of historical fact included in this Annual Report on Form 10-K are forward-looking statements.
	You can identify these statements by words such as &ldquo;aim,&rdquo; &ldquo;anticipate,&rdquo; &ldquo;assume,&rdquo; &ldquo;believe,&rdquo;
	&ldquo;could,&rdquo; &ldquo;due,&rdquo; &ldquo;estimate,&rdquo; &ldquo;expect,&rdquo; &ldquo;goal,&rdquo; &ldquo;intend,&rdquo;
	&ldquo;may,&rdquo; &ldquo;objective,&rdquo; &ldquo;plan,&rdquo; &ldquo;potential,&rdquo; &ldquo;positioned,&rdquo; &ldquo;predict,&rdquo;
	&ldquo;should,&rdquo; &ldquo;target,&rdquo; &ldquo;will,&rdquo; &ldquo;would&rdquo; and other similar expressions that are predictions
	of or indicate future events and future trends. These forward-looking statements are based on current expectations, estimates,
	forecasts and projections about our business and the industry in which we operate and our management's beliefs and assumptions.
	These statements are not guarantees of future performance or development and involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and
	other factors that are in some cases beyond our control. All forward-looking statements are subject to risks and uncertainties
	that may cause actual results to differ materially from those that we expected, including:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to raise additional capital on favorable terms or at all;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to achieve profitability and positive cash flows;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to manage our growth effectively;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to retain key personnel;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to enter into additional licensing transactions;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The potential for our clinical trials to produce negative or inconclusive results;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to obtain significant revenue for our tobacco products;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.1IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.1IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to obtain U.S. Food and Drug Administration (&ldquo;FDA&rdquo;) clearance for our potentially modified risk tobacco
	products and FDA approval for our
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	smoking cessation aid;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to gain market acceptance for our products;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Any potential negative impact from entering the cannabis space;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to comply with government regulations;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to compete with competitors that may have greater resources than we have;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The potential for our competitors to develop products that are less expensive, safer or more effective than ours;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The potential exposure to product liability claims, product recalls and other claims; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Our ability to adequately protect our intellectual property and to avoid infringement on rights of third parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	For the discussion of these risks and uncertainties
	and others that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in our forward-looking statements, please
	refer to &ldquo;Risk Factors&rdquo; in this Annual Report on Form 10-K. The forward-looking statements included in this Annual
	Report on Form 10-K are made only as of the date hereof. We undertake no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking
	statement as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, except as otherwise required by law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Unless the context otherwise requires,
	references to the &ldquo;Company&rdquo; &ldquo;we&rdquo; &ldquo;us&rdquo; and &ldquo;our&rdquo; refer to 22nd Century Group, Inc.,
	a Nevada corporation, and its direct and indirect subsidiaries.

<B>
	PART I
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15%; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<A NAME="V430187_10K_HTM_MAIN_002">
</A>
	Item 1.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 85%; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Business.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Background
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	22nd Century Group, Inc. was incorporated
	under the laws of the State of Nevada on September 12, 2005 under the name Touchstone Mining Limited. On January 25, 2011, we entered
	into a reverse merger transaction with 22nd Century Limited, LLC, which we refer to herein as the &ldquo;merger.&rdquo; Upon the
	closing of the merger, 22nd Century Limited, LLC became our wholly-owned subsidiary. After the merger, we succeeded to the business
	of 22nd Century Limited, LLC as our sole line of business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	22nd Century Limited, LLC was
	originally formed as a New York limited liability company on February 20, 1998 as 21st Century Limited, LLC and subsequently
	merged with a newly-formed Delaware limited liability company, 22nd Century Limited, LLC, on November 29, 1999. Since
	inception, 22nd Century Limited, LLC has sponsored research and subsequently used biotechnology to regulate the nicotine
	content in tobacco plants.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We are a plant
	biotechnology company focused on technology that allows us to increase or decrease the level of nicotine and other
	nicotinic alkaloids in tobacco plants and levels of cannabinoids in cannabis plants through
	genetic engineering and plant breeding. Our primary mission is to reduce the harm caused by smoking. We own or
	exclusively control more than 200 issued patents plus more than 50 pending patent applications.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We are in the process
	of transitioning from researching and developing our proprietary technology and tobaccos to commercializing our technology
	and products. We initiated the commercialization of our technology and products in the year 2015. According to
	Euromonitor International annual worldwide tobacco product sales, including cigarettes and smokeless products, are
	approximately $800 billion, most of which are cigarette sales. If we capture a small fraction of this market, we believe our
	value will increase tremendously.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We are primarily involved in the following
	activities:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 5%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 95%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The research and development of potentially less harmful or modified risk tobacco products and novel tobacco plant varieties;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The pursuit of necessary regulatory
	approvals and clearances from the FDA to market
<I>
	&nbsp;BRAND A
</I>
	&nbsp;in the U.S.
<I>
</I>
	as an over-the-counter product
	labeled as reduced exposure to nicotine as
<I>
	&nbsp;BRAND A
</I>
	&nbsp;has 95% less nicotine than conventional tobacco
	cigarettes;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
	&middot;
</TD>
<TD>
	The development of
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	, a prescription-based smoking cessation aid consisting of very low nicotine
	(&ldquo;VLN&rdquo;) cigarettes, and the pursuit of regulatory approvals and clearances from the FDA to market X-22 as a
	prescription smoking cessation aid;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The pursuit of necessary regulatory
	approvals and clearances from the FDA to market
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	&nbsp;as a modified risk cigarette with an extremely low
	tar-to-nicotine ratio;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The manufacture, marketing and distribution of
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	and
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	proprietary cigarettes;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The production of
<I>
	SPECTRUM
</I>
	research cigarettes for the National Institute on Drug Abuse (&ldquo;NIDA&rdquo;), a part of the National Institutes of Health (&ldquo;NIH&rdquo;);
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The international licensing of our technology, proprietary tobaccos, and trademarks;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The international sale of our branded proprietary tobaccos;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The contract manufacturing of third-party branded tobacco products; and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The research and development in Canada of unique
	plant varieties of hemp/cannabis, such as (i) plants with low to no amounts of delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol, or THC, for the legal
	hemp industry, and (ii) plants with high levels of cannabidiol, or CBD, and other non-THC cannabinoids for the legal medical marijuana
	markets.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Our prospects depend on our ability
	to generate and sustain revenues from (i) licensing and/or sale of our proprietary tobacco, technology and
	products; (ii) domestic and international sales of our brands, including
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	and
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	; (iii)
	further development of our potential modified risk tobacco products and our
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	smoking cessation aid; and (iv) the
	manufacture of the filtered cigar and cigarette brands of third-parties at our manufacturing facility in North Carolina. Our
	ability to generate meaningful revenue from our potential modified risk tobacco products in the United States depends on
	obtaining FDA authorization to market these products as modified risk or reduced exposure; and our ability to generate
	meaningful revenue in the United States from
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	depends on FDA approval. If these products are authorized and
	approved by the FDA, we must still meet the challenges of successful marketing, distribution and consumer acceptance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 4; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;

	4

<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We believe our products address
	unmet needs of smokers; for those who desire to quit, an innovative smoking cessation aid, and for those who are unable or unwilling
	to quit smoking, cigarettes that may reduce the level of exposure to tobacco toxins and/or nicotine.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We believe our proprietary
	technology, tobaccos and products will generate multiple significant revenue streams from licensing of our technology and
	tobacco and from the sales of our products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	Intellectual Property
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Our intellectual property enables us
	to decrease or increase the level of nicotine and other nicotinic alkaloids in
	tobacco plants by decreasing or increasing the expression of gene(s) responsible for nicotine production in the tobacco plant
	using genetic engineering. The basic techniques include, but are not limited to, those that are used in the production of
	genetically modified (&ldquo;GM&rdquo;) varieties of other crops, which are also known as &ldquo;biotech crops.&rdquo;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We own or exclusively control more than
	200 issued patents plus more than 50 pending patent applications. A &ldquo;patent family&rdquo; is a set of patents
	granted in various countries to protect a single invention. Our patent coverage in the United States and China, two of the most
	valuable smoking cessation and cigarette markets in the world, consists of 27 issued patents and 21 pending applications and 6
	issued patents and 6 pending patent applications, respectively. We have exclusive rights to all uses of the following genes responsible
	for nicotine content in tobacco plants:
<I>
	NBB
</I>
	,
<I>
	QPT
</I>
	,
<I>
	A622
</I>
	,
<I>
	MPO
</I>
	and several transcription factor genes.
	We have exclusive rights to plants with altered nicotine content produced from modifying expression of these genes and tobacco
	products produced from these plants. We also have the exclusive right to license and sublicense these patent rights. With the exception of two patent families, which will expire in 2016 and 2018, the majority of the patent families related to nicotine biosynthesis will expire between 2021 and 2034, with certain extensions of terms in the U.S. applications resulting from patent term adjustments at the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	In September 2014, we entered into a
	Sublicense Agreement with Anandia Laboratories, Inc. (the &ldquo;Anandia Sublicense&rdquo;). Under the terms of the
	Anandia Sublicense, we were granted an exclusive sublicense in the United States and a co-exclusive sublicense in the
	remainder of the world, excluding Canada, to 1 U.S. patent and 20 patent applications relating to four genes in the cannabis
	plant that are required for the production of cannabinoids, the active ingredients in the cannabis plant. The Anandia
	Sublicense continues through the life of the last-to-expire patent, which is expected to be in 2035. As a plant biotechnology
	company, our entry into the legal hemp/cannabis markets is a natural evolution of our activities in a plant that has
	important research and commercial value and applications. We intend to engage in research and development activities in
	Canada to create unique plant varieties of hemp/cannabis, such as (i) plants with low to no amounts of THC for the legal hemp
	industry, and (ii) plants with high levels of CBD and other non-THC cannabinoids for the legal medical marijuana markets.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 2.2PT; TEXT-INDENT: 37.4PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We own various registered trademarks
	in the United States. We also have exclusive plant variety rights in the United States (plant variety protection certificates
	are issued by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (&ldquo;PVP&rdquo;)) and Canada. A PVP certificate prevents anyone other than the
	owner/licensee from planting, propagating, selling, importing and exporting a plant variety for twenty (20) years in the U.S.
	and generally for twenty (20) years in other member countries of the International Union for the Protection of New Varieties
	of Plants, known as UPOV, an international treaty concerning plant breeders&rsquo; rights. There are currently more than 70
	countries that are members of UPOV.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	Licensing our technology and tobacco
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We have been in negotiations with various
	parties in the tobacco and pharmaceutical industries for licensing our technology and products. On October 1, 2013, our subsidiary,
	22nd Century Limited, LLC (&ldquo;22nd Century Ltd.&rdquo;), entered into a Research License and Commercial Option Agreement (the
	&ldquo;BAT Research Agreement&rdquo;) with British American Tobacco (Investments) Limited (&ldquo;BAT&rdquo;), a subsidiary of
	British American Tobacco plc.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Under the terms of the BAT Research Agreement,
	BAT receives an exclusive worldwide license to certain patent rights (subject to worldwide rights retained by 22nd Century Ltd.
	for use in its own brands and products) and licensed intellectual property rights (as such terms are defined in the BAT Research
	Agreement) of 22nd Century Ltd. within the field of use (as defined in the BAT Research Agreement) for a period of up to four (4)
	years (the &ldquo;Research Term&rdquo;). During the Research Term, BAT also has an option, which can be exercised by BAT at any
	time during the Research Term, to obtain an exclusive worldwide license (subject to worldwide rights retained by 22nd Century Ltd.
	for use in its own products and brands) to commercialize certain products derived from utilizing the patent rights and licensed
	intellectual property rights under the terms of a commercial license agreement (the &ldquo;Commercial License&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Simultaneous with the signing of the BAT
	Research Agreement, BAT paid 22nd Century Ltd. a non-refundable fee of $7.0 million. Further, 22nd Century Ltd. may receive payments
	from BAT of up to an additional $7.0 million during the Research Term in the event certain milestones are met by BAT with respect
	to its research and development of the patent rights and licensed intellectual property rights licensed by 22nd Century Ltd. to
	BAT. There are four separate milestones, two of which BAT would pay 22nd Century Ltd. $2.0 million for each milestone achieved,
	and two of which BAT would pay 22nd Century Ltd. $1.5 million for each milestone achieved. BAT may terminate the BAT Research Agreement
	at any time, subject to the requirements for certain payments to 22nd Century Ltd. by BAT upon termination as set forth therein.
	22nd Century Ltd. may also terminate the BAT Research Agreement in the event of certain uncured breaches of the BAT Research Agreement
	as set forth therein.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	BAT also granted to 22nd Century Ltd. a
	worldwide license to any and all registered research results (as such term is defined in the BAT Research Agreement) developed
	and owned by BAT which results or arises from any research, development or other activities of BAT under the BAT Research Agreement,
	with the terms of such license from BAT to 22nd Century Ltd. (i) to be on commercially reasonable terms to be negotiated in good
	faith between the parties, but in any event on terms which are no more onerous than the terms of the Commercial License, if any,
	and (ii) to be dependent on what, if any, research results the Company elects to license.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	If BAT exercises the option for
	a worldwide Commercial License, BAT is required to pay 22nd Century Ltd. $3.0 million in aggregate annual license fees over
	a 2-year ramp-up period, and thereafter a royalty, subject to annual minimums and maximums contained in the Commercial
	License, of (i) $100 per metric ton of licensed tobacco that is supplied to, or grown and ready for shipment to, BAT and its
	affiliates (other than Reynolds American, Inc. and Reynolds&rsquo; affiliates) and all other third parties; and (ii) $200 per
	metric ton of licensed tobacco supplied to, or grown and processed by, BAT&rsquo;s affiliate Reynolds American, Inc.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Beginning three years from the start of
	the Commercial License, both 22nd Century Ltd. and BAT may license/sublicense rights to any unaffiliated third party for use of
	the technology outside the United States and 22nd Century Ltd. and BAT will equally share all profit from all such licensees/sublicensees.
	Inside the United States, BAT may only sublicense BAT&rsquo;s commercial rights to Reynolds American Inc. 22nd Century Ltd. may
	sublicense any party in the United States.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	RED SUN and MAGIC Cigarettes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Our subsidiary, Goodrich
	Tobacco Company, LLC (&ldquo;Goodrich Tobacco&rdquo;), introduced in a limited capacity two super-premium priced cigarette
	brands,
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	and
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	, into the U.S. market in the first quarter 2011. From the year 2011 through the year
	2014, there were
<I>
	de minimis
</I>
	sales of these brands since we intentionally did not expand the marketing and distribution
	of these brands until after the Company became a subsequent participating manufacturer under the Master Settlement
	Agreement (&ldquo;MSA&rdquo;) which occurred on August 29, 2014, when the 46 Settling States under the MSA approved the
	Company to acquire NASCO Products, LLC (&ldquo;NASCO&rdquo;) and become a subsequent participating manufacturer under the
	MSA. During the remainder of 2014, the Company
	worked to obtain approvals from regulatory agencies in all 50 States to have our
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	super-premium brand listed on
	the state directories of tobacco products approved for sale in each such state. During 2014, we also worked with Orion,
	a cigarette manufacturer in Poland, to contract manufacture the Company&rsquo;s proprietary tobacco products for
	distribution in the European Union, starting with our
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	super-premium brand. Both of the
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	and
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	brands are available in regular and menthol and all brand styles are king size and packaged in hinge-lid hard
	packs. In 2015, we focused our marketing efforts for
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	on national and regional distributors, tobacconists,
	smokeshops and other tobacco outlets in the U.S. In 2015, we also introduced our
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	cigarettes to distributors
	and retailers in Spain, as explained in greater detail below under &ldquo;International Sales.&rdquo;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	MSA Membership
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	In September 2013, the Company
	entered into a Membership Interest Purchase Agreement to purchase all of the issued
	and outstanding membership interests of NASCO, a federally licensed tobacco product manufacturer and subsequent participating
	manufacturer under the MSA (the &ldquo;NASCO Acquisition&rdquo;). On August 29, 2014, the Company entered into an Amended
	Adherence Agreement with the 46 Settling States under the MSA pursuant to which the Company was approved to acquire NASCO and
	become a subsequent participating manufacturer under the MSA. On that same date, the Company closed the NASCO Acquisition and
	became a subsequent participating manufacturer under the MSA. NASCO is now a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 6; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	Manufacturing
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	In December 2013, Goodrich Tobacco purchased
	certain (i) cigarette manufacturing equipment, and (ii) equipment parts, factory items, office furniture and fixtures, vehicles
	and computers from the bankruptcy estate of PTM Technologies, Inc. (&ldquo;PTM&rdquo;) for $3.22 million. In January 2014, Goodrich
	Tobacco purchased additional miscellaneous equipment, factory items, office furniture and fixtures, vehicles and computers from
	the bankruptcy estate of Renegade Tobacco Co. (&ldquo;Renegade&rdquo;) for $210,000. PTM and Renegade were related companies located
	in North Carolina undergoing Chapter 7 liquidation proceedings in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Middle District of
	North Carolina. Goodrich Tobacco subsequently received $631,484 in net proceeds from auctioning off certain cigarette manufacturing
	equipment and other items not required for operations at the Company&rsquo;s factory in Mocksville, North Carolina.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	The warehouse and cigarette manufacturing
	facility were primarily in a pre-manufacturing stage during 2014 as we sought approval during that time for the Company and its
	factory to become a subsequent participating manufacturer under the MSA. On August 29, 2014, the Company closed its acquisition
	of NASCO and became a subsequent participating manufacturer under the MSA. The Company is now manufacturing its cigarette brands
	in the United States through its wholly-owned subsidiary, NASCO, at the Company&rsquo;s factory in North Carolina. In 2015, we
	manufactured and sold our
<I>
	RED SUN
</I>
	super-premium brand, together with a third-party MSA cigarette brand and third-party filtered
	cigars, at our factory.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	International Sales
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	The Company makes its
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	super-premium brand at Orion, a cigarette manufacturer in Poland that contract manufactures
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	cigarettes for the
	Company for distribution in the European Union. Orion is a manufacturer and distributor of smoking tobaccos, cigarettes,
	filter tubes, and smoking accessories with distribution in more than 20 countries. Distribution of
<I>
	MAGIC
</I>
	brand
	cigarettes commenced in Spain in 2015. In 2015, the Company also entered into new distribution agreements with European
	partners for the launch of the Company&rsquo;s products in additional European countries. The Company is
	also evaluating the sale and distribution of its products in Asia.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	The Tobacco Control Act and Our Potentially
	Modified Risk Cigarettes - BRAND A and BRAND B
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	In a 2005 analyst report,
<I>
	The Third
	Innovation, Potentially Reduced Exposure Cigarettes
</I>
	, JP Morgan examined the effects of regulation by the U.S. Food and Drug
	Administration (&ldquo;FDA&rdquo;) of tobacco, including the market for safer cigarettes. JP Morgan&rsquo;s proprietary survey
	of over 600 smokers found that 90% of smokers are willing to try a safer cigarette. Among JP Morgan&rsquo;s other conclusions,
	it stated: &ldquo;FDA oversight would imbue PREPS [&lsquo;potential reduced exposure products&rsquo; which essentially equate to
	potential modified risk tobacco products] with a regulatory &lsquo;stamp of approval&rsquo; and allow for more explicit comparative
	health claims with conventional cigarettes. Consumers should trust the FDA more than industry health claims.&rdquo; Prior to the
	Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act (&ldquo;Tobacco Control Act&rdquo;) becoming law in 2009, no regulatory agency
	or body had the authority to assess potentially modified risk tobacco products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	The Tobacco Control Act granted
	the FDA authority over the regulation of all tobacco products. While the Tobacco Control Act prohibits the FDA from banning
	cigarettes outright, it allows the FDA to require the reduction of nicotine or any other compound in tobacco and cigarette
	smoke. The Tobacco Control Act also banned all sales in the U.S. of cigarettes with characterizing flavors (other than
	menthol). As of June 2010, all cigarette companies were required to cease the use of the terms &ldquo;low tar,&rdquo;
	&ldquo;light&rdquo; and &ldquo;ultra light&rdquo; in describing cigarettes sold in the U.S. Besides numerous other
	regulations, including certain marketing restrictions, for the first time in history, a U.S. regulatory agency now
	scientifically evaluates cigarettes that may pose lower health risks as compared to conventional cigarettes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	The Tobacco Control Act establishes procedures
	for the FDA to regulate the labeling and marketing of modified risk tobacco products, which includes cigarettes that (i) reduce
	exposure to tobacco toxins and (ii) are reasonably likely to pose lower health risks, as compared to conventional cigarettes (&ldquo;Modified
	Risk Cigarettes&rdquo;). The Tobacco Control Act requires the FDA to issue specific regulations and guidance regarding applications
	submitted to the FDA for the authorization to label and market Modified Risk Cigarettes. On March 30, 2012, the FDA issued
<I>
	Modified Risk Tobacco Product Applications Draft Guidance.
</I>
	We believe that two types of our cigarettes in development, which
	we refer to as
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	&nbsp;and&nbsp;
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	, may qualify as Modified Risk Cigarettes. In addition, the Tobacco
	Control Act allows the FDA to mandate the use of reduced risk technologies in conventional tobacco products and cigarettes (e.g.,
	Marlboro
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, Camel
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, Newport
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, Natural American Spirit
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	), which
	could create opportunities for us to license our proprietary technology and/or our tobaccos to larger competitors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 7; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	7
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We believe that our
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	and
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	cigarettes will benefit smokers who are unable or unwilling to quit smoking and who may be interested in
	cigarettes which reduce exposure to nicotine or to certain tobacco smoke toxins and/or pose a lower health risk than
	conventional cigarettes. This includes approximately one-half of the 42 million adult smokers in the United States who do not
	attempt to quit in a given year. Compared to commercial cigarettes, the tobacco in
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	has approximately 95% less
	nicotine than tobacco in cigarettes previously marketed as &ldquo;light&rdquo; cigarettes and
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	&rsquo;s smoke
	contains an extraordinarily low amount of &ldquo;tar&rdquo; per milligram of nicotine. We believe
	that&nbsp;
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	&nbsp;and
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	will achieve market share in the global cigarette market among smokers who
	will not quit but are interested in reducing the harmful effects of smoking. We believe this new regulatory environment
	represents a paradigm shift for the tobacco industry. There is no guarantee, however, that we will (i) have sufficient
	capital to complete the FDA authorization process for our potential Modified Risk Cigarettes, (ii) obtain FDA authorization
	to market
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
<I>
	or
</I>
	&nbsp;
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	&nbsp;as Modified Risk Cigarettes, or (iii) achieve significant share
	of the market even with FDA authorization to market our products as Modified Risk Cigarettes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	On December 31, 2015, we submitted to
	the FDA a Modified Risk Tobacco Product application requesting a reduced exposure marketing authorization from the FDA to market
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	as a Modified Risk Cigarette with product labeling and advertising that states that
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	has 95% less
	nicotine than conventional cigarettes. We intend to work diligently with the FDA to obtain a reduced exposure marketing authorization
	for
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	to be marketed in the U.S. We also intend to seek FDA authorization in the future to (i) market
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	as a Modified Risk Cigarette with an extraordinarily low amount of &ldquo;tar&rdquo; per milligram of nicotine and (ii) market
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	as a prescription smoking cessation product.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
<I>
	BRAND A Cigarettes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Compared to commercial tobacco cigarettes,
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	has the lowest nicotine content. The tobacco in
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	contains approximately 95% less nicotine than conventional cigarette brands. Clinical studies have demonstrated that smokers who smoke very low nicotine (&ldquo;VLN&rdquo;) cigarettes
	containing our proprietary tobacco smoke fewer cigarettes per day resulting in significant reductions in smoke exposure, including
	&ldquo;tar,&rdquo; nicotine and carbon monoxide. Due to the very low nicotine levels, compensatory smoking does not occur with
	VLN cigarettes containing our proprietary tobacco (Hatsukami
<I>
	et al
</I>
	. 2010).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	In a June 16, 2010 press release, Dr.
	David Kessler, the former FDA Commissioner, recommended that &ldquo;[t]he FDA should quickly move to reduce nicotine levels
	in cigarettes to non-addictive levels. If we reduce the level of the stimulus, we reduce the craving. It is the ultimate harm
	reduction strategy.&rdquo; Shortly thereafter in a
<I>
	Washington Post
</I>
	newspaper article, Dr. Kessler said that the amount
	of nicotine in a cigarette should drop from about 10 milligrams to less than 1 milligram.
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	cigarettes contain
	approximately 0.7 milligrams of nicotine in the tobacco contained in the cigarette and a machine smoking yield of less than
	0.05 mg of nicotine per cigarette.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	There have been seven (7) independent, scientific
	clinical studies utilizing our proprietary VLN tobacco cigarettes, with each study showing the efficacy of our VLN tobacco cigarettes
	when used alone and/or when used in conjunction with existing nicotine replacement therapies (&ldquo;NRTs&rdquo;), such as the
	nicotine patch, gum or lozenge, or Pfizer&rsquo;s Chantix/Champix product. These seven (7) clinical studies are all summarized
	below under &ldquo;Business &ndash; Products &ndash; X-22 Smoking Cessation Aid.&rdquo; The results of such clinical studies using
	cigarettes made from our Company&rsquo;s proprietary VLN tobacco have demonstrated many desirable outcomes, including reduced smoking,
	reduced nicotine exposure, reduce nicotine dependence, increased abstinence, reduced exposure to toxicants and few adverse events
	with little evidence of withdrawal-related discomfort or safety concerns. Unlike &ldquo;light&rdquo; cigarettes (as previously
	labeled and marketed by conventional tobacco companies) which reduce machine-smoking nicotine yields by diluting the smoke rather
	than by reducing the nicotine content of the tobacco itself, VLN cigarettes do not result in compensatory smoking.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	The most recent clinical trial utilizing
	our proprietary VLN tobacco was reported on in the October 2015 issue of
<I>
	The New England Journal of Medicine
</I>
	(N Engl J
	Med 2015; 373:1340-1349), which was funded by the National Institute on Drug Abuse (&ldquo;NIDA&rdquo;) and the U.S. Food and
	Drug Administration (FDA) Center for Tobacco Products. The Center for the Evaluation of Nicotine in Cigarettes led the double-blind,
	parallel, randomized clinical trial involving 840 smokers at ten locations. The authors concluded that data from the study suggests,
	as compared with cigarettes of conventional nicotine content, 22nd Century&rsquo;s proprietary VLN cigarettes were &ldquo;associated
	with reductions in smoking, nicotine exposure, and nicotine dependence, with minimal evidence of nicotine withdrawal, compensatory
	smoking, or serious adverse events.&rdquo; The study&rsquo;s lead author, Dr. Eric Donny, explained that &quot;The evidence is
	getting stronger that reducing nicotine reduces smoking and makes people less addicted to cigarettes and, in doing so, might make
	them more likely to quit.&quot;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Utilizing the results of these and other
	independent clinical trials, on December 31, 2015, we submitted to the Center for Tobacco Products (&quot;CTP&quot;) of the FDA
	an application for
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	to receive a marketing order from the FDA to allow
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	to be marketed and sold in
	the U.S. as a reduced exposure product that exposes a user to 95% less nicotine than conventional cigarettes
<I>
	.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We believe these and other results and
	future exposure studies the FDA may require will result in a reduced exposure marketing order to be granted by the FDA for
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	. We further believe smokers who desire to smoke fewer cigarettes per day while also satisfying cravings and reducing
	exposure to nicotine will find
<I>
	BRAND A
</I>
	beneficial.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 8; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	8
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<I>
	BRAND B Cigarettes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Using a proprietary high nicotine tobacco
	blend in conjunction with specialty cigarette components,
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	allows the smoker to achieve a satisfactory amount of
	nicotine per cigarette while inhaling less &ldquo;tar&rdquo; and carbon monoxide. At the same time, we do not expect exposure to
	nicotine from
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	to be significantly higher than some commercially available full flavor cigarette brands. We believe
	smokers who desire to reduce smoke exposure, but are less concerned about nicotine, will find
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	beneficial.
<I>
	BRAND
	B
</I>
	has a &ldquo;tar&rdquo; yield between typical &ldquo;light&rdquo; and &ldquo;ultra-light&rdquo; cigarettes, but a nicotine
	yield of typical full flavor cigarettes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	In a 2001 report, entitled
<I>
	Clearing
	the Smoke, Assessing the Science Base for Tobacco Harm Reduction
</I>
	, the Institute of Medicine notes that a low &ldquo;tar&rdquo;/moderate
	nicotine cigarette is a viable strategy for reducing the harm caused by smoking. The report states: &ldquo;Retaining nicotine at
	pleasurable or addictive levels while reducing the more toxic components of tobacco is another general strategy for harm reduction.&rdquo;
	We believe that evaluation of
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	in short-term human exposure studies will confirm that exposure to smoke, including
	certain tobacco smoke toxins and carbon monoxide, is significantly reduced when smoking
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	as compared to smoking the
	leading brands of cigarettes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Our Company has engaged a major contract
	research organization (&ldquo;CRO&rdquo;) with extensive experience in tobacco exposure studies to assist us in certain regulatory
	activities at the CTP related to the Company&rsquo;s research to support the development of potentially less harmful or modified
	risk cigarettes. The Company and the CRO met with the CTP on November 12, 2014 to discuss the development plan and proof of concept
	study for
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	, a cigarette that produces smoke containing an extraordinarily low amount of &ldquo;tar&rdquo; per milligram
	of nicotine.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	We believe results from this and other
	exposure studies will warrant a modified risk claim for
<I>
	BRAND B
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	X-22 Smoking Cessation Aid
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	is a tobacco-based botanical
	medical product for use as an aid to smoking cessation. The
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	therapy protocol utilized in our sponsored Phase IIb clinical
	trial calls for the patient to smoke our VLN cigarettes over a six-week treatment period to facilitate the goal of the patient
	quitting smoking by the end of the treatment period. We believe this therapy protocol has been successful in independent clinical
	trials because VLN cigarettes made from our proprietary tobacco satisfy smokers&rsquo; cravings for cigarettes while (i) greatly
	reducing nicotine exposure and nicotine dependence and (ii) extinguishing the association between the act of smoking and the rapid
	delivery of nicotine.
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	involves the same smoking behavior as conventional cigarettes and because patients are simply
	switching to VLN cigarettes for 6 weeks,
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	does not expose the smoker to any new drugs or new side effects.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Approximately 50% of U.S. smokers attempt
	to quit smoking each year, but only 2% to 5% actually quit smoking in a given year. It takes smokers an average of 8 to 11 &ldquo;quit
	attempts&rdquo; before achieving long-term success. Approximately 95% of &ldquo;self-quitters&rdquo; (i.e., those who attempt to
	quit smoking without any treatment) relapse and resume smoking. The Institute of Medicine, the health arm of the National Academy
	of Sciences, in a 2007 report concludes: &ldquo;There is an enormous opportunity to increase population prevalence of smoking cessation
	by reaching and motivating the 57 percent of smokers who currently make no quit attempt per year.&rdquo; We believe that our
<I>
	X-22
</I>
	smoking cessation aid will be attractive to smokers who have been frustrated in their previous attempts to quit smoking
	using other therapies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Use of existing smoking cessation aids
	results in relapse rates that can be as high as 90% in the first year after a smoker initially &ldquo;quits.&rdquo; Smokers currently
	have the following limited choices of FDA-approved products to help them quit smoking:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 82%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	varenicline (Chantix
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	/Champix
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	outside the U.S.), manufactured by Pfizer, Inc.,
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	bupropion (Zyban
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	), manufactured by GlaxoSmithKline plc, and
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	nicotine replacement therapy, or &ldquo;NRT,&rdquo; which is available in the U.S. in several forms: gums, patches, nasal sprays, inhalers and lozenges.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
	Chantix
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	and Zyban
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	are pills and are nicotine free. Chantix
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, Zyban
<SUP>
	&reg;
</SUP>
	, the nicotine nasal spray and the nicotine inhaler
	are available by prescription only in the U.S. Nicotine gums, nicotine patches, and nicotine lozenges are available over-the-counter
	in the U.S.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 27.5PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 9; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%">
	&nbsp;

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	9
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->

	&nbsp;
